Overload.descr: Align buffer A to autoalign buffer
Absolute value of following <number>
Logical operator
First argument passed to a function
Second argument passed to a function
Third argument passed to a function
Fourth argument passed to a function
Fifth argument passed to a function
Sixth argument passed to a function
Arc-tangent of following <number>, between -90 and 90 degrees
Arc-tangent of first <number> divided by second <number>, between -180 and 180 degrees

Set limits on the absolute focus reached during autofocus runs. Follow with a <lower> and a <upper> limit as given by ReportAbsoluteFocus, or 0 0 to cancel these limits. Autofocus will abort when a limit is exceeded.

Adds a <key> - <value> pair to the last section of the autodoc associated with the current open file, if any. The next word after the command is the key, and the remainder of the text on the line is taken as the value. Variables are substituted before using the text. After one or more additions to a section of the autodoc, a WriteAutodoc command must be used to save the values before closing the file or saving another image to it.

Adds a <key> - <value> pair to the last section of the autodoc opened with the Open .mdoc for Frames command. This works just like AddToAutodoc, but the WriteFrameMdoc command must be used instead after adding values.
Align buffer A to given buffer (e.g. B). Optionally, enter 1 for 'noIS' to avoid changing microscope image shift
Allow 'OpenNewFile' and 'OpenNewMontage' to overwrite an existing file if <allow> is 1, or disallow it again if <allow> is 0.
Report whether any of the dewars in a temperature control system are busy filling (reported value 1 is set to 0 or 1)
Align buffer A to autoalign buffer
Start the Beam Autocenter routine

Autofocus; set optional first number to -1 to just measure defocus without changing or 1 for normal autofocus that changes focus to target; set optional second number to 1 to focus with View area in Low Dose mode.
Set beam tilt direction for autofocusing to <value> (from 0 to 3)
Stops execution of the innermost Loop containing this statement
Cosine of following <angle> in degrees
Stores the current standardized focus value as the standard focus for the current mag, just as the Calibrate menu item Standard Focus does.
Calibrate image shift at the current mag. Do the calibration from scratch if the optional <value> is nonzero.
Calls other macro by <name>. Names are case-sensitive and must match exactly, including spaces

Calls the function with the given <name> and supplies <arguments> for the function to receive. If the name could occur in more than one macro, it must be qualified with a macro number or name, i.e. '5::GoodFunc' or 'Func Macro::GoodFunc'.
Calls other macro by <name> and returns
Report unbinned size in X and Y of current camera

Center beam using the existing image in the active buffer by detecting the edges of the beam, or from the centroid of the image intensities if <value> is nonzero. In the latter case the beam should be completely within the camera field.
Change the energy loss by the <value>
Change defocus by the given <value> in microns
Change beam intensity by the given <factor> using calibrations. In low dose mode this changes the intensity of the current area.
Change mag by given <number> of mag steps
Change mag by the given <number> of mag steps and change the beam to maintain the same brightness. Behaves same as SetMagAndIntensity.
Report the X and Y center coordinate and the radius in microns for the circle through three points whose coordinates are given on the line as <X1> <Y1> <X2> <Y2> <X3> <Y3>.
Clear the alignment shift of the image in buffer A
Removes all persistent variables defined with :=
Close the current file. Enter optional <e> to stop macro if no file is open.
Align buffer A to the given <buffer> assuming a specimen rotation given by <number>. Optionally, enter 1 for <show> to show the cross-correlation.
Skips the rest of the current iteration of the innermost Loop containing this statement
Run the Specimen Cooker routine
Copy from buffer1 to buffer2 (e.g., Copy C A)
Crop out a subarea of the given <buffer> from <X0> to <X1> in X and from <Y0> to <Y1> in Y. Coordinates are numbered from 0 to size - 1 in each dimension and 0 in Y is at the top.
Tilt down by preset increment
Do not stack Falcon intermediate frames after the next exposure. To stack frames from multiple exposures into one stack, use this command before each exposure except the last one.
Wait for given amount of <time>. The optional <units> can be 'msec', 'sec', or 'min'. If no units are given, a <time> <= 60 is taken to be seconds, and a <time> > 60 is taken to be milliseconds
Report the time remaining for until next automatic dewar filling, or -1 if none is scheduled
Switches to given <macro>

Return as early as possible from the next acquisition, which must involve saving dose-fractionation frames from a K2 camera. Follow with the <number> of frames to be summed in the returned image, 0 to return without any summed image, or -1 to return with the full sum (the latter is available only on GMS 2.31 or higher). Single-shot and dose-fractionation images can be requested without delay in the macro. The single-shot images will be taken as soon as possible (after the end of the exposure before GMS 2.31, after the frame stack has been accessed in GMS 2.31 and higher). Another dose-fractionation shot will be delayed until saving is finished for the current shot.
Prints the <text> to the log window

Report the min, max, mean, and SD of the A buffer, or of the indicated <buffer> scaled to electrons, and also report the electrons per unbinned pixel per second. The camera must have a defined counts per electron.
Inside of an If/Endif block, starts a block that is executed if the expression after the 'If' and any preceding 'ElseIf' commands is false

expression Inside of an If/Endif block, starts a block that is executed conditionally on the value of 'expression' if the expressions in the starting If statement and any preceding ElseIf statements were not true.
Required ending to a function definition.
Marks the end of the loop
Ends a block started with If

Opens a dialog box for the user to enter one floating point or integer <value>. Follow with the <default> value to show in the box, the number of decimal places to show for a float entry or -1 for an integer entry, and the prompt <text> on the rest of the line. Sets reportedValue1 to the entered value.
Get a filename through a dialog with a simple text box and open it as a new file. If the optional <prompt> string is not supplied, the prompt is 'Enter name for new file:'.
Opens a dialog box for the user to enter one floating point number, with the given <text> as the prompt. Sets reportedValue1 to the entered value.
Makes most macro error messages be duplicated in the log window. Follow with an optional <value> of 0 to turn off the feature again.
Refine eucentricity, or if optional <value> is entered, do rough eucentricity only (1), refine only (2), both steps (3), or refine and realign (6)
Ends execution unconditionally
Take a film exposure
Acquire image with 'focus' parameters
Run the routine to find the pixel size in an image of a cross-line grating.

Flashes between a yellow screen and normal image display several times. The first optional entry <times>, sets the number of times to flash (default 4) and the second optional entry, sets the <duration> of each state in seconds (default 0.3). Total duration may not exceed 6 seconds.
Acquire image with 'focus' parameters
Makes Realign to Item align to the map center instead of skipping the first round because it was aligned to recently

Defines a function with the given <name> (without embedded spaces). The optional <number> indicates the number of numeric arguments and <s> is non-zero to indicate that a string argument occurs after the numeric ones. Functions must be placed at the ends of macros.

Autofocus; set optional first <value> to -1 to just measure defocus without changing or 1 for normal autofocus that changes focus to target; set optional second <view> to 1 to focus with View area in Low Dose mode.
Switches to the low dose area given by <area>, which must be one of V, F, T, R, or S. This will not work if the screen is down.
Starts a block that is executed conditionally on the value of <expression>

Report the parameter set that an image was taken with and whether it was taken in Low Dose mode, for the image in buffer A or in the buffer indicated by <buffer>. For one of the 5 standard parameter sets, it will report the set name. For a montage image, it will report Record. For a tracking image, it will report View if the mag matches that of View in Low Dose; if the mag matches Record in Low Dose, it will report Record or Preview depending on which has an closest exposure time closest to that of the image.
Report size in X and Y, binning, exposure, pixel size, and parameter set used for the image in buffer A or in the buffer indicated by <buffer>
Change image shift by given distance on specimen (<X> is tilt axis)
Change image shift by given values of pixels in camera <X> and <Y>
Change image shift by given values of IS units in <X> & <Y>

Increase or decrease mag by one step if the pixel size has been found at the current mag with the Find Pixel Size routine, depending on whether <value> is positive or negative. Sets reportedValue1 to 1 if the mag is changed, 0 otherwise.
Change the C2/C3 lens strength percentage or illuminated area in microns by the given <amount>
Change the defocus target by <value>
Report whether the PVP is running on an FEI scope.
Reports whether a <variable> is defined, placing a 1 in reportedValue1 if it is and a 0 if it is not. Follow with the variable name without a $.

Set the item <number> that Navigator supplies supermontage coordinates from when a montage image is acquired. Set the number to 0 to restore Navigator to using coordinates from the item currently being acquired.

If the user presses 'B', or the key given by the optional <key> entry, the macro breaks out of the innermost Loop containing this statement. 'key' should be a letter or number; the test for the key is case-insensitive.
Acquire image with 'preview' parameters

List the names of macro-callable functions in all loaded plugins along with the arguments that they expect, in parentheses. For each argument, there should be one item provided on the command line calling the function, with all items separated by spaces as usual. Two exceptions to this are: a string argument at the end can include spaces; an argument listed as [out]double is a returned value, assigned to reportedValue2 or higher.
Loads the cartridge from the given <slot> (numbered from 1) if there is an autoloader.
A longer <name> to appear in the Run submenu of the Macro menu; if this name is not defined, the regular MacroName appears there.

Starts one or more time-consuming <operation>s: Buffer cycle (Bu), Refill refrigerant (Re), Inventory cassettes (In), Loader buffer cycle (Lo), Dark reference update for K2 (Da). Operations are identified by the first two letters of whatever full word you use (case insensitive). Each operation except Inventory must be followed by an <interval> in hours. If <interval> is > 0, the operation is done only if the time since the last such operation is greater than <interval>; if <interval> is 0, the operation is done unconditionally; if <interval> is < 0, it simply records the current time as the time of the last operation. The scope operations will occur sequentially and be started in the order that they are listed. The dark reference update will be done simultaneously with scope operations. If an error occurs in a scope operation, other operations will be finished and the error reported at the end. Errors other than in refilling refrigerant will cause the macro to stop. The user interface should not hang during long operations, and users will be asked to confirm that they want to kill the operation threads if they press STOP or try to exit the program. The consequences of killing these threads are uncertain.
Loop the given <value> of times until EndLoop; optionally set <variable> with index
Acquire montage
Remainder upon dividing nearest integer to <first> number by nearest integer to <second> one
Name the macro to the given <text>, which can include spaces
Subject line for an email message (default is 'Message from SerialEM macro'). The <text> can include variables to be substituted.
Create a directory named by the date and time (e.g., Aug15_12.23.15) under the current directory and change to this as the new working directory.
dir Create the <directory> if it does not already exist. It can contain spaces. The parent directory must already exist.
Film exposure <time> in seconds for manual exposures, or 0 for automatic exposure (the default)
Acquire montage
Sets the X and Y position of the currently selected piezo to <X>, <Y>, or if the optional third argument <arg> is non-zero, moves the piezo by X, Y
Sets the <Z> position, or position of a single-axis piezo, to <Z> for the currently selected piezo, or if the optional second argument <arg> is non-zero, moves the piezo by <Z>
Move stage by micron increments in <X>, <Y>, <Z> (Z optional)
Move stage to given position in microns. <Z> is optional and <Z> will not be changed if it is omitted.

Move the stage to a Navigator <item>; if no <item> is entered, move to the current Navigator item or to the item that this macro is being run on, otherwise move to the item whose index in the table is <item> (numbered from 1)
Nearest integer to following <number>
Make the current image or montage a new Navigator map

Normalize all lenses, or in a lens group, on an FEI scope. With <value> equal to 0 or not present, it normalizes all lenses in one call. Otherwise, <value> can be the sum of 1 to normalize the illumination group (which includes condenser, minicondenser, and objective lenses) and 2 to normalize the projection group (which includes objective and projector lenses) in a separate call.
Normalize selected lenses on an FEI or Hitachi scope; <value> is the sum of 1 for projector, 2 for objective, 4 for condenser lenses

Opens the protection cover of the Direct Electron camera for the remainder of the macro, if it is the current camera. Without this command, the cover will be opened and closed for each exposure except during tasks.

Open a file whose name starts with the last name used for saving frames from a K2 or Falcon camera, and ends with the string <suffix> given in the command. The string can contain spaces and variables.

Open a file with the given <name>, which can contain spaces. The file properties dialog will be bypassed. Since the current working directory can be unpredictable, depending on whether the user has opened a file with the file chooser, it is advisable either to specify an absolute path for the filename, or use a 'SetDirectory' with an absolute path.

Open a file with the given <name> for montaging, with the number of frames in X and Y given by <X> and <Y>. If either <X> or <Y> is 0, the number of frames will be taken from the last montage that was open. The file properties and montage setup dialogs will be bypassed, and some properties like overlap and whether to do a stage montage will be taken from the last montage that was open.
Open an existing MRC or ADOC file with the given <name>, which can contain spaces.
In low dose mode, autofocus in area on opposite side of Record from the defined Focus area; if optional <value> is -1, just measure defocus without changing. Not available if Balance Shifts is on.
In low dose mode, acquire Focus image from area on opposite side of Record from the defined Focus area. Opposite areas are not available if Balance Shifts is turned on.
In low dose mode, acquire Trial image from area on opposite side of Record from the defined Trial area.
Logical operator
<First> following number raised to the power of the <second> number
Opens message box with optional <text> plus question of whether to proceed with macro

Call the function <func> in the plugin named <name> with appropriate list of <arguments> for that function. Arguments are entered as items separated by spaces, except that a string argument at the end may consist of multiple words. The return value of the function is reported and placed into reportedValue1.

If montaging is enabled with stage movement, this command lowers the screen to expose the specimen, then moves the stage to each piece position and waits there for the number of seconds indicated by <secs>.
Acquire image with 'preview' parameters
Prints the program version and build date, and the current date and time.

[n] [f1] [f2] Report means of strips along quadrant boundaries. Optional entries are <n> for the number of pixels between strip and boundary (default 2), <f1> for the strip width as a fraction of quadrant extent (default 0.1), and <f2> for the fraction of quadrant extent to trim off the length of the strip (default 0.1). Output is labeled by quadrant number (1 to 4) and 'h' for horizontal strips or 'v' for vertical strips.

Run the camera timing calibration routine in quick flyback mode for an FEI STEM camera, where <set> specifies the camera parameter set and must be V, F, T, R, or P, and <exp> is the exposure time to use. The routine will not ask for confirmation before saving the resulting flyback time and startup delay in the master list of flyback times.
Acquire image with 'record' parameters
Round <first> following number to the number of decimal places given by second <number>
Reads the given <section> (numbered from 0) from the current open file into the standard Read buffer, or into the buffer indicated by the optional <buffer>

Realign to the current Navigator item, or to the item that this macro is being run on. For <restore>, enter 1 to restore the microscope state to the current state after the procedure, or 0 not to. For optional <continous>, enter 1 to use continuous acquisition mode and end it at end of procedure, or 2 to leave it running if possible.

Realign to the Navigator item whose <index> in the table, numbered from 1. For <restore>, enter 1 to restore the microscope state to the current state after the procedure, or 0 not to. For optional <continous>, enter 1 to use continuous acquisition mode and end it at end of procedure, or 2 to leave it running if possible.
Acquire image with 'record' parameters
Report time of day and run Refine Zero Loss Peak procedure
Report the refrigerant level of the given <dewar>: 1 for autoloader, 2 for column, 3 for liquid helium
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
Place at end of macro to repeat it
Report an absolute (standardized) value for the current focus setting
Report sum of shifts given by ReportAlignShift or ReportShiftDiffFrom
Report the X and Y alignment shift of the current image in A in unbinned pixels on image, in nanometers along the image shift axes, and in nanometers on the specimen, where the tilt axis is along X.

Report the sum of left and right borders and the sum of top and bottom borders in the last autoalign for the image in A and for the reference image. The numbers are in pixels of the respective images before the additional binning applied for correlation, and will thus differ from the binned values reported by the autoalign routine.
Reports alpha value on JEOL.
Report measured defocus from last autofocus
Report the beam shift in nominal micron units
Reports the beam tilt in milliradians for FEI, % of full-scale value for JEOL
Report seconds elapsed since last ResetClock command
Returns -1 if continuous acquisition is not running, or the camera parameter set number being used if it is running, numbered from 0.
Report current defocus readout in microns
Report the slit width, energy loss, and whether the slit is in or out (the latter is placed in reportedValue3 as a 1 or 0)
Report the number of frames in currently open file
Same as 'ReportAbsoluteFocus', which is a better description of the operation
Report the drift estimate from the last autofocus, if available
Reports whether a frame .mdoc file is open; sets reportedValue1 to 1 if so.

For the current Navigator item or the item this macro is being run on, reports a code for whether the item is first to be acquired in a group: -1 if Navigator not acquiring, 0 if not in a group, 1 if first to be acquired in a group, 2 if later in the group. If the group would show up on more than one line with 'Collapse groups' on, a value of 1 is returned for the first item to be acquired in each subgroup. It also reports the group ID of the item (ID is 0 for an item not in a group).
Report the illuminated area on a Titan
Report the image shift in IS units, adjusted for tilt axis offset, image shift offset, and low dose area shift
Reports the lateral offset of the tilt axis estimated from the last Refine Eucentricity run; aborts the macro if no offset is available.
Report whether low dose is on or not and the current area, if it is defined. The number of the area (0 for V, etc.) is placed in reportedValue2.
Report the current mag; also set reportedValue2 to 1 if low mag mode, 0 if not
Report the current mag index; also set reportedValue2 to 1 if low mag mode, 0 if not
Report the mean counts of the A buffer, or of the indicated <buffer>; set <unbinned> to 1 to get unbinned counts per second

Report the index, stage X, Y, Z, label, and note string for the current Navigator item, or the item this macro is being run on. The index and stage coordinates are placed in 'reportedValue' variables as usual, and the item type is placed in 'reportedValue5' (0 for point, 1 for polygon, 2 for map). In addition, variables 'navLabel', and 'navNote' are set with the label and note strings, and variables 'navIndex' and 'navIntLabel' are set with integer values of the item index (numbered from 1) and of the label (up to any non-numeric characters). If the Navigator is currently acquiring at points, a variable 'navAcqIndex' is set with the number of items already acquired plus 1. Any of these variables can then be used to make filenames, and the latter two can be used in arithmetic and IF statements.
Report the X and Y values of the objective stigmator, between -1 and 1
Report similarly on the Navigator item whose <index> in the table, numbered from 1.

Report the percent C2/C3 (on the Tecnai, this number matches the value in TUI) and the fractional lens strength. On a Titan, if illuminated area is being used for intensity, this reports the illuminated area value.
Reports the X and Y position of the currently selected piezo
Reports the Z position, or the position of the only axis for a single-axis piezo, of the currently selected piezo
Reports whether an FEI scope is in nanoprobe or microprobe mode; sets first reported value to 0 or 1, respectively.

Report the difference between the alignment shift of the current image and the given <value> in microns, as percentage of the value; the cumulative sum of differences in microns, and the total sum of shifts in microns. For monitoring variability in successive stage movements.
Report the status of the cartridge <slot> (numbered from 1) if there is an autoloader. Status is -1 for an error, 0 for empty, and 1 for occupied.
Report the current spot size
Report current stage position
Report the defocus target
Report current tilt angle
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
When a 'Report...' command is used, the values reported are generally assigned to variables named 'reportedValue1', 'reportedValue2', and so on up to 6
Reset the sum of shifts given by ReportAlignShift to 0 or ReportShiftDiffFrom
Reset the time reported by ReportClock to 0
Sets the defocus readout to 0, just as Reset Defocus in Focus menu does.
Reset image shift and move stage to compensate
Reset image shift and realign image if image shift is greater than the given <value> in microns

Restore one or all camera parameter set(s) modified with the 'Set' commands above. If <set> is omitted, all modified sets will be restored. The set <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.
Restores the focus value when SaveFocus was run. After this is run, the focus will not be restored again when the macro ends.
Retracts all retractable cameras
Without executing to the end of the current macro, returns to calling macro or ends execution if this is the top-level macro
Work out backlash and realign image after reversing tilt direction; enter optional <dir> 1 or -1 to specify a specific direction for further tilts
Save image in A or in <buffer> to current open file, or to the given file <number>
Sine of following <angle> in degrees
Square root of following <number>; generates error if it is negative
Save image in A or in <buffer> to current open file, or to the given file <number>
Saves the current focus; the focus will be restored to this value either by RestoreFocus or when the macro stops or exits. The macro will not be resumable if it stops.

Closes the log window and opens a new one. If a log file has been saved, the log is automatically saved to it before closing. If there is no log file and the log has new contents since program startup, the program will ask the user whether to save to log first; if the user cancels, the macro is aborted.
Lower the main screen
Raise the main screen
Make the given <camera> (numbered from 1) be the active camera. Will switch in and out of EFTEM mode or STEM mode if appropriate.
Select a piezo drive for reports or movements, follow with the <plugin> number (numbered from 0, enter 0 if there is only one plugin controlling piezos) and the <piezo> number (numbered from 0).

Send an email containing the given <text>, which can include variables to be substituted. An SMTP server and address to send from must be defined in the properties file, and recipient(s) must be defined using 'Set Email Address' in the Tilt Series Menu.
Set focus to a an absolute (standardized) <value> as reported earlier by ReportAbsoluteFocus or ReportFocus
Sets alpha <value> on JEOL.

Modifies the axis position, and optionally the rotation of the inter-area axis, for the Focus and/or Trial <area>. Follow with F or T to specify the area (both will be changed if Focus and Trial settings are being kept identical); with <dist>, the distance in microns; and optionally with <angle>, a rotation angle. If an angle is set, the option to apply the angle will be turned on in the Low Dose control panel. Low dose mode must be on to use this command.
Blank beam if value is 1, unblank if value is 0
Set the beam shift to the given values (nominal micron units)

Set <binning> for exposure <set>. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.
Set the camera length index to the given <number>; on the Tecnai, values higher than 30 set the index to (# - 30) in LAD mode

Set the acquisition area for exposure <set>. Follow the set specifier S with either 4 numbers for the unbinned <left>, <right>, <top>, and <bottom> coordinates (the same kind of numbers as in the camera setup dialog) or with F, H, Q, WH or WQ for full, half, quarter, wide half, or wide quarter. Values will be adjusted for a legal area. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.

Set exposure <set> for acquisition from a centered area. Follow the <set> specifier with 3 numbers: the binning B, the binned size in X, and the binned size in Y. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.
Close column/gun valve or turn off filament if <value> is 0; open valve or turn on filament if <value> is 1

Set the acquisition mode for exposure <set> for continuous if <cont> is non-zero, or single-frame if <cont> is 0. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.
Set the defocus to the given <value> in microns
Change the working directory to <dir>, which can contain spaces.
Set the energy loss to the <value>

If in low mag, sets to the standard focus for the current mag or nearest LM mag if one has been set; otherwise on FEI it assumes standard focus is 0 and on JEOL it stops with an error. If not in LM, sets to the standard focus for the nearest nonLM mag if one has been set or stops with an an error if none were set. On FEI scopes, it issues a warning if it is using a calibrated value from a different mag.

Set exposure and, optionally, drift settling for exposure <set> to the given values <exp> and <drift>. If D is omitted, the existing drift settling will be unchanged. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.

Set the image shift to the given values (image shift units). The values correspond to the ones give by ReportImageShift, which are adjusted for tilt axis offset, image shift offset, and low dose area shift
Adjust beam intensity by the change in cosine of the tilt angle from the last tilt change. In low dose mode, this changes the intensity only of the Record area.

Adjust beam intensity to yield the given <number> of counts, based on counts in the tilt-foreshortened area of the image in A. In low dose mode, this operates only on Record images and will change the intensity only of the Record area.

Set the <fraction> of the usual settling time to apply in continuous mode after image shift or stage movement. By default, no settling is applied in continuous mode (i.e., the fraction is 0), but some settling may be needed when a macro or other operation is using continuous frames. The fraction is reset to zero when continuous mode ends.
Turns low dose <mode> on for nonzero or off for 0; the previous state of low dose is saved in reportedValue1 as a 0 or 1.
Set the <mag> to an actual film mag value

Set the <mag> to the actual film mag value and change the beam to maintain the same brightness. Two values are reported: the initial percent C2 value and the remaining factor of intensity change needed if it was not possible to change the intensity by the full amount needed. The C2 value should be used to restore intensity when the mag is restored. The remaining intensity change could be applied to the exposure time if necessary. The macro will stop if there is an error in the intensity change.

Sets up to 6 montage parameters; enter a value or -1 to leave the parameter unchanged. The entries are: 1 to use <stage> movement or 0 not to; overlap in X; overlap in Y; frame size in X; frame size in Y, 1 to <skip> correlations or 0 not to.

Set to 0 to open files as MRC, or 1 to open files as a TIFF <series> described in an image autodoc file. The optional second <value> sets whether to open montaged files as MRC or as a TIFF series, but only if the property MontageAutodocOptions is set.
Calls SetObjFocus on JEOL with the given <value>, an integer increment, and reports change in focus
Set the objective lens stigmator to the given values (between -1 and 1)
Set the C2/C3 lens <strength> to the given percentage, or illuminated area on Titan to given value in microns.
Sets the <mode> to microprobe or nanoprobe on an FEI scope. Follow with 0 or 'nano' for nanoprobe, or 1 or 'micro' for microprobe.

Set the STEM <detector>s for each available channel of exposure <set>. Follow the set specifier with a detector number for each channel, numbered from 0, or -1 to select no detector for that channel. At least one actual detector must be specified. The <set> can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes.
Insert the slit; or if <value> is entered, insert if 1 or retract if 0
Set energy filter slit <width> in eV
Set the <spot> size to the given number
Same as 'SetAbsoluteFocus', which is preferred to avoid confusion with the calibrated standard or eucentric focus <value>
Set the defocus target to value

Open a montage file or adjust the current file's properties so that it will hold an image of the cross-line (waffle) replica grating with at least <blocks> in X and Y at the current magnification. Follow with the <minimum> of blocks and the <name> of the file to be opened if necessary. If montaging is not needed, no changes are made. If there is an existing montage that is adequate, its properties will be adjusted to work at the current mag. If a new montage is needed, it will close the current file if it is a montage and open a new one with the given name. Variables will be substituted, so the name can contain the mag index, for example. It sets reportedValue1 to 1 or 0 depending on whether montaging is needed or not.

Keeps projector lens normalization from being done before the next image or stage shift calibration provided that normalization was last done at the current magnification. Follow with an optional 0 to NOT <skip> normalization.

Apply image shift during the next exposure to compensate for a drift in <X> and <Y> given by the first and second numbers; the third number should be 0 if the <drift> is in unbinned pixels/sec and 1 if it is in nm/sec
Shift items at the current registration by the alignment shift of the image in buffer A. If rerun on the same image, it applied the change in shift between the current and previous run.
Display the given <buffer> (e.g., Show C)

Sets the current montage to skip pieces outside the Navigator item whose <position> in the table (numbered from 1). If <position> is 0, uses the current item. If <position> is < 0, disables the skipping of pieces.

Skips forward to the line starting with the given <label>, where the label has a colon (:) at the end of it and is the only item on the line. The colon is not included in the label in the SkipTo statement.

Change focus linearly through next exposure. Follow with 2 numbers, the <starting> and <ending> defocus relative to the current focus. This command and StepFocusNextShot are enabled for Gatan, Falcon, and Tietz cameras.

Expose film with special handling: the first specifies a <delay> in seconds after loading the plate; the second number specifies a <pre>-exposure of the specimen before exposing the plate, in seconds. The third suppresses <dimming> of the screen if it is nonzero. This command command does not raise the screen if it is down. It requires the adaexp server to be installed.

Do one or two focus changes during the next exposure. Follow with 2 or 4 numbers: the <time> in seconds from start of the exposure to the first focus change, the first <focus> change in microns, the <time> from start of the exposure to the second focus change if any, and the second <focus> change relative to the starting focus, not relative to the focus after the first change. The command will have no effect if the exposure time is less than the time to the first change, and the second change will not be done if the time for it is greater than the exposure time.
Stops continuous acquisition if it is running.
Report the mean counts in a subarea of the A buffer from <X0> to <X1> in X and from <Y0> to <Y1> in Y. Coordinates are numbered from 0 to size - 1 in each dimension and 0 in Y is at the top.
Do not print any of these reports, just assign the values to report variables
Make the given file <number> be the current open file.
Acquire image with 'trial' parameters
Tangent of following <angle> in degrees
Change tilt by the given <amount>
Tilt down by preset increment
Tilt to given <angle>
Tilt up by preset increment
Acquire image with 'trial' parameters
Tilt up by preset increment
If there is an autoloader, unloads the cartridge.

Assign current stage Z value to the whole group that the current Navigator item, or item that this macro is being run on, belongs to. The item must have a non-zero group ID. If the group would show up on more than one line with 'Collapse groups' on, items on all lines will be updated, unlike with the 'Update Z' button.

Updates the K2 hardware dark reference if the known interval since the last update is longer than <value> in hours. If value is 0, the update is done unconditionally; if value is negative (-1), it simply records the current time as the time of the last update.
Assign current stage Z value to the current Navigator item, or item that this macro is being run on.

If <value> is non-zero, the macro will keep executing commands (such as stage movement and alignment) even when the camera is acquiring in continuous mode. Use 0 to return to normal operation, in which the macro will wait for continuous acquisition to be ended by the user.

Open a directory chooser dialog to allow user to select or make a directory, and change the working directory to it. If the optional <prompt> string is not supplied, the dialog title is 'Choose a new current working directory'. The chosen directory is stored in reportedValue1.
Acquire image with 'view' parameters
Turns echoing of each macro line on or off for <value> 1 or 0
Acquire image with 'view' parameters

Start accumulating <dose> and wait until it reaches the given value in electrons per square Angstrom. Enter the optional value to set how many times it <reports> progress while waiting (default is 10). Be sure that the screen is down and, if in low dose, that the beam is unblanked.

After starting a continuous acquisition, use this command to wait until the next image becomes available. The program will wait until the exposure time has elapsed so that the image is likely to be taken after completion of previous operations. The 'UseContinuousFrames 1' command must be used before the acquisition is started.
Tilt up to given <angle> in steps and track image position
Writes the autodoc associated with the current open file. Use this command once after adding one or more values to a section of the autodoc.
Writes the frame autodoc file; use this command after adding one or more values to a section.
Opens a Yes-No message box with the given <text>, which should be a question that can be answered with yes or no. Sets reportedValue1 to 1 or 0 for a yes or no answer.
